ARABIC: وَذَٰلِكُمْ ظَنُّكُمُ ٱلَّذِى ظَنَنتُم بِرَبِّكُمْ أَرْدَىٰكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم مِّنَ ٱلْخَٰسِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is that thought you had about your Lord that has destroyed you so now you find yourselves among the lost.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: It is this notion you had of your Lord that caused your ruin, and you are lost."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This thought of yours about your Lord has led to your perdition and you have become among the losers.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This was how you considered your Lord, but He knows you better than you know yourselves. Thus, you are now lost".
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And this is the assumption you had regarding your Lord, which has ruined you, so you are now among those who have been defeated.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And that thought of yours which you thought about your Lord, has brought you to destruction; and you have become of those utterly lost!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And that was your (evil) thought which you entertained about your Lord that has tumbled you down into perdition, so are you become of the lost ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: That then, the thought you thought about your Lord, has destroyed you, and therefore you find yourselves this morning among the losers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: That, your thought which ye did think about your Lord, hath ruined you; and ye find yourselves (this day) among the lost.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but these thoughts which you entertained concerning your Lord, have brought you to destruction, and [now] you are among the utterly lost!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: That thought of yours which ye formed concerning Your Lord, hath ruined you, and ye have become of the losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: That misjudgement, which you entertained about your Lord ruined you. So you became losers.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But this thought of yours which ye did entertain concerning your Lord, hath brought you to destruction, and (now) have ye become of those utterly lost!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And that thought of yours which you thought about your Lord, has brought you to destruction, and you have become (this Day) of those utterly lost!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Rather, it is the thoughts you thought about your Lord that have destroyed you, therefore, this morning you find yourselves among the losers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It is that thought of yours about your Lord that led you to ruin—so you became of the losers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And that was your assumption which you assumed about your Lord. It has brought you to ruin, and you have become among the losers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [41:23] And that (wa-dhālikum, the subject) supposition of yours (zannukum, substitutes for it) which you supposed of your Lord (alladhī zanantum bi-rabbikum, a descriptive clause; the predicate [is the following, ardākum]) has ruined you, that is, it has brought about your destruction. So you have become among the losers’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (That, your thought which ye did think about your Lord) this which you said falsely about your Lord because of surmise (hath ruined you) has destroyed you; (and ye find yourselves (this day) among the lost) by being subject to punishment.
